net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature

Class AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
  • Type Parameters:
    VALUE - is the generic type of the value.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>, UiFeature, UiFeatureValidation<VALUE>, UiFeatureValue<VALUE>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>, AttributeReadValue<VALUE>, AttributeWriteValue<VALUE>, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<VALUE>, ValidatableObject<VALUE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidationWithValidators, AbstractUiWidget

    public abstract class AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
extends Object
implements UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
    This is the abstract base implementation of UiFeatureValueAndValidation.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • setValueForUser

        public final void setValueForUser(VALUE value)
        This method is like AttributeWriteValueAdvanced.setValue(Object) but will NOT set the original value and will set the modified to true (instead of false).
        Specified by:
        setValueForUser in interface AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to set.

      • getValue

        public final VALUE getValue()
        This method gets the value of this object. This will typically be a newly created object.
        ATTENTION:
        If the current value entered by the user can NOT be parsed, this method will catch and ignore the exception and return null instead. If you want to do validation and give feedback to the user please use AttributeReadValueAdvanced.getValueOrException(Object) instead. However, there are higher-level ways to do this such as getValueAndValidate.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface AttributeReadValue<VALUE>
        Returns:
        the value of this object. May be null unless otherwise stated.

      • handleGetValueError

        protected void handleGetValueError(RuntimeException e,
                                   ValidationState state)
        This method handles a RuntimeException that occurred in UiFeatureValueAndValidation.getValueDirect(Object, ValidationState).
        Parameters:
        e - is the RuntimeException to handle.
        state - is the ValidationState or null if no validation is performed.

      • getValueOrException

        public VALUE getValueOrException(VALUE template)
                          throws RuntimeException
        This method is like AttributeReadValueAdvanced.getValue() but does NOT catch exceptions while parsing the value from the user input. Additionally it allows to provide a template object that gets populated. This allows advanced features with polymorphism as you can also provide a sub-class of <VALUE>.
        Specified by:
        getValueOrException in interface AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>
        Parameters:
        template - is the object where the data is filled in. May also be null - then this method will create a new instance.
        Returns:
        the current value of this widget. May be null if empty. If the value type is String the empty String has to be returned if no value has been entered. In case <VALUE> is a mutable object (java bean) and template is NOT null, this method is supposed to return template.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the entered value is invalid (e.g. paring caused a NumberFormatException).

      • getValueAndValidate

        public final VALUE getValueAndValidate(ValidationState state)
        This method is a combination of AttributeReadValueAdvanced.getValue() and AbstractValidatableObject.validate(ValidationState). It is designed for API users implementing higher level dialog logic and is therefore easy to use. It performs a validation and only on success it returns the value.
        ATTENTION:
        The method design assumes that null is not a valid value. Never call this method with null as argument if <VALUE> is Void or anything else that considers null as a valid value. It should be used for high-level UI nodes such as entire input forms or (sub-)dialogs.
        Specified by:
        getValueAndValidate in interface UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
        Parameters:
        state - is the ValidationState. Shall initially be created as new instance and passed on in case of recursive validations. May also be null and will then be created internally (in case you do not need the validation result).
        Returns:
        the actual value or null if the validation failed or null is the actual (valid) value.

      • resetValue

        public final void resetValue()
        This method resets this widget. It is a convenience method for the following code. 
        setValue(AttributeReadValueAdvanced.getOriginalValue())
        Specified by:
        resetValue in interface AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>

        public void addValidatorMandatory()

        Specified by:

      • validate

        public final boolean validate(ValidationState state)
        This method performs the actual validation.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface AbstractValidatableObject
        Parameters:
        state - is the ValidationState. Shall initially be created as new instance and passed on in case of recursive validations. May also be null and will then be created internally (in case you do not need more feedback than a boolean result).
        Returns:
        true if the validation of this object has been successful, false otherwise (if there are validation failures).
